introduction.section1: I love learning practical programs to help me organize information by better efficient way. Usually, I will pay attention to the trends of technology, finance and art, which can constantly increase my knowledge, and can also learn a different ways of thinking and solutions. If I encounter a problem while developing, I can often find many resources on the web to help me solve it.
introduction.section2: So, I am grateful for live in this generation.

pentium-network.instruction:
● Building a main application and micro-frontend projects using webpack5 and Module Federation
● Writing unit tests and component tests using Jest & React Testing Library
● Implementing code checks with CI using GitHub Actions
● Implementing multilingual support using i18next

Project:
● Developing the new product 'Mavis Auto'
　○ Building the main application using Vite, Webpack5, and Module Federation
　○ Implementing identity authentication with Auth0
　○ Utilizing Split.js to create expandable areas, enabling the app to accommodate various extensions in the future
　○ Integrating the Cloud Credential micro-frontend
　○ Designing the project architecture

● Developing the new product 'Repository'
　○ Responsible for developing repository search functionality and file upload functionality

● Developing Component Library
　○ Using antd to develop common components for the company's product code base, enabling high reusability across various products and micro-frontend projects, saving development time and maintaining UI consistency
　○ Packaging with rollup and publishing to the company's internal npm private server
　○ Using Storybook to Writing component documentation and usage examples.
　○ Responsible for developing the 'Upload,' 'UploadModal,' 'SelectionArea,' and 'SearchFilter' components

● Developing and designing a micro-frontend framework for internal company use
　○ Enabling faster and more convenient development of new Micro Apps, allowing developers working on micro-frontend to focus solely on the functionality of their respective applications
　○ Using MobX state management to handle communication between different micro-frontend
　○ Developing the communication interface between the main application and micro-frontend

● Maintenance of the 'MRVN' product - https://www.pentiumnetwork.com/old-mrvn
　○ Using webpack 5 and Module Federation to integrate React micro-frontend into a Vue app
　○ Adding permissions and management functionality to accommodate the mounting of micro-frontend for repositories
　○ Optimizing and fixing bugs

● Maintenance of the 'Mavis' product - https://www.pentiumnetwork.com/mavis
　○ Adding features as required

● Maintenance of the 'GateOne' library (Pentium forked) - https://github.com/liftoff/GateOne
　○ Fixing bugs related to cursor and pointer operations in the web terminal simulator

bibian.instruction:
● Use next.js & Redux to build front-end system
● Write unit tests with Jest & component tests with React Testing Library
● Use Husk with Eslint, Prettier & Jest to practice git commit automated testing and correction
● Use swiper to achieve carousel effect
● According to the Figma provided by the design, use styled-components to make the page
● Planning api with back-end developer

Project:
● Develop "Drug Bibian" - https://drug.bibian.co.jp/
　○ Project Construction
　○ Mainly responsible for the home page and product page
　○ Write the product data structure that "BBC bar" can parse, which can reduce the cost of parsing and development, and can be tested

● Maintain "Cross-border Purchase Service" - https://shinohara-ss.shop-pro.jp/?pid=138207062
　○ Parse the HTML document of the partner e-commerce, and convert the product page into a data that can be used by the "BBC bar"
　○ Refactoring projects using Web Components
　　■ Reduce development costs by 90%, and more as demand increases
　　■ Reduce initial page load speed

● Maintain "Product Inclusion Tool - Chrome Extension"
　○ Optimize webpack to increase building speed
　○ Repurchase and optimization projects
　　■ Split component, page
　　■ Integration api, "chrome.runtime.sendMessage"
　　■ Form validation into "custom hook"
　　■ Fix bugs

● Refactored "Buy on Demand" channel (refactored version is not online) - https://www.bibian.co.jp/bbcstore/
　○ Divide component blocks, so that the background can be set for different blocks, providing customized web page layout
　○ Can reduce development costs by 90%, and can continue to create new blocks with designers
　○ Use "React Hook Form" for form validation and provide background form filling function
　○ For the purpose of reduce the first load of the page, practice infinite scrolling of the page
　○ The background setting interface provides the component dragging function to adjust the order of products
　○ UI/UX optimization

bankpro.instruction:
● Development of sunnybank Enterprise Internet Bank - https://b2bank.sunnybank.com.tw/eb/
　○ Mainly responsible for functions: account transaction inquiry, user management settings and transfer transaction functions in Taiwan and foreign currencies
　○ Use "formik" for form validation, providing form filling functions
　○ Connect the card reader to handle authentication and set the chip card password
　○ ".csv" and ".txt" file download, web friendly printing
　○ Use "react-intl" to implement multiple languages
　○ Analysis and planning of redux and saga code splitting can reduce the first code load, which is estimated to be reduced by more than 50%
　○ The code provided by the outsourcers is integrated into the React project, and UI/UX optimization if necessary
